required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Expanding the Reach of a Validated Smoking-Cessation Intervention: A Spanish-Language Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute

clinical_study.source: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock:
Results of a recently completed National Cancer Institute (NCI) funded trial of an intervention, Forever Free: Stop Smoking for Good, revealed high efficacy throughout the 24- month follow-up period, further supporting the utility of extended self-help for promoting and maintaining tobacco abstinence. Investigators have recognized that wide-scale implementation, and therefore public health impact, would be enhanced by the availability of a Spanish-language version to reach the largest and fastest growing ethnic minority population of smokers.
The goal of this study is to address this gap by testing a Spanish-language version of the validated self-help smoking cessation intervention. If demonstrated effective, the proposed intervention would represent an easily disseminable and low-cost intervention with significant public health impact for Hispanic/Latino smokers throughout the United States. The aims of this project are to test the efficacy of a Spanish-language version of a validated, extended self-help intervention for smoking cessation among Spanish-speaking smokers against usual care control. Participants (N = 1400) recruited nationally will be randomized to the two arms.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Tobacco Abstinence at 6 Months
primary_outcome.description: Participants will complete follow-up assessment packets at 6 month intervals through 24 months. At each assessment point, investigators will calculate 7-day point- prevalence abstinence rates.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Tobacco Abstinence at 12 Months
primary_outcome.description: Participants will complete follow-up assessment packets at 6 month intervals through 24 months. At each assessment point, investigators will calculate 7-day point- prevalence abstinence rates.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Tobacco Abstinence at 18 Months
primary_outcome.description: Participants will complete follow-up assessment packets at 6 month intervals through 24 months. At each assessment point, investigators will calculate 7-day point- prevalence abstinence rates.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Tobacco Abstinence at 24 Months
primary_outcome.description: Participants will complete follow-up assessment packets at 6 month intervals through 24 months. At each assessment point, investigators will calculate 7-day point- prevalence abstinence rates.

arm_group.description: Spanish-Language Version of the Stop Smoking for Good: The Extended Self-help condition will comprise the 11 Stop Smoking for Good booklets and 9 supportive My Story pamphlets transcreated for Spanish speaking smokers.

NCI-Produced Spanish-language Self-help Booklet: The UC control condition enhances the external validity of the study by providing a comparison to an existing, credible intervention that a smoker could receive in a medical setting or elsewhere.

intervention.intervention_name: Spanish-Language Version of the Stop Smoking for Good
intervention.description: Participants in the first arm will receive the Spanish-language version of the Stop Smoking for Good (SS-SP) intervention distributed over 18 months.
Participants in the second arm will receive a single, credible, NCI-produced Spanish-language self-help booklet.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Smoking â‰¥ 5 tobacco cigarettes/week over the past year
- Not currently enrolled in a face-to-face smoking cessation program
- Monolingual Spanish-speaking, or bilingual Spanish-English and prefer receiving educational health materials in Spanish

overall_official.affiliation: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute

facility.name: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute

link.description: Moffitt Cancer Center Clinical Trials website

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Extended Self-help
group.description: Spanish-Language Version of the Stop Smoking for Good: The Extended Self-help condition will comprise the 11 Stop Smoking for Good booklets and 9 supportive My Story pamphlets transcreated for Spanish speaking smokers. Spanish-Language Version of the Stop Smoking for Good: Participants in the first arm will receive the Spanish-language version of the Stop Smoking for Good (SS-SP) intervention distributed over 18 months.

group.title: Usual Care (UC)
group.description: NCI-Produced Spanish-language Self-help Booklet: The UC control condition enhances the external validity of the study by providing a comparison to an existing, credible intervention that a smoker could receive in a medical setting or elsewhere. NCI-Produced Spanish-language Self-help Booklet: Participants in the second arm will receive a single, credible, NCI-produced Spanish-language self-help booklet. Outcomes will be assessed through 24 months.

group.title: Extended Self-help
group.description: Spanish-Language Version of the Stop Smoking for Good: The Extended Self-help condition will comprise the 11 Stop Smoking for Good booklets and 9 supportive My Story pamphlets transcreated for Spanish speaking smokers. Spanish-Language Version of the Stop Smoking for Good: Participants in the first arm will receive the Spanish-language version of the Stop Smoking for Good (SS-SP) intervention distributed over 18 months.

group.description: NCI-Produced Spanish-language Self-help Booklet: The UC control condition enhances the external validity of the study by providing a comparison to an existing, credible intervention that a smoker could receive in a medical setting or elsewhere. NCI-Produced Spanish-language Self-help Booklet: Participants in the second arm will receive a single, credible, NCI-produced Spanish-language self-help booklet. Outcomes will be assessed through 24 months.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
